ground_truth: A SMOKER steps in, and Dante manages to break his study of the O.C. oddity and searches for the smokes. The smoker glances at Randal and then at the O.C. oddity. The smoker looks at Randal. The odd man places a handkerchief over an egg on the floor and quickly whisks the handkerchief away to reveal the egg still sitting on the floor. Dante, Randal, and the smoker stare at the O.C. man. Then, a little girl comes into view, smiling and holding money. She can't be any more than five. A female customer pops items onto the counter and stands silently, awaiting something. Dante rings her up. Randal flips open the magazine's centerfold, revealing a graphic picture of a woman with her vaginal lips and anus spread wide open. Dante frantically apologizes to the rapidly exiting customer. Randal checks out the centerfold wistfully. A woman pulls out gallon after gallon, looking deep into the cooler for the perfect container of milk. A series of people address the camera, asking dumb questions, while others stand in various locations throughout the convenience store, asking truly dumb questions. Dante gives Randal a shove to shut him up. Veronica enters the store, carrying books and something covered with aluminum foil, and Dante is suddenly by her side, taking the books from under her arm. Randal makes loud slurping noises from O.C. and walks past the two, patting Veronica on the head as he exits. She exits too. Randal is recommending titles to potential customers and pops his head in to make the loud slurping noise again before hanging up. Randal joins Dante, then walks away, causing Dante to shake his head in frustration and pick up the phone again, rolling his eyes to the ceiling. Randal comes back. Tape is rolled around the top of a stick; an orange ball is slapped back and forth by a blade, and laces are pulled tightly. Randal enters, wearing his equipment as the hockey players fill the convenience store. Sanford skates up and skids to a halt, and on the roof, they jump off the ladder and skate around. From across the street, we get the full, odd perspective of a store with many men gliding around on the roof. Some sit on the floor or lean against the coolers, but all are either preparing or practicing. On the roof, Dante skates and passes with another player, while the players ascend a ladder adjacent to the door, one by one. Randal pulls his mask on and slaps his glove, urging a shot. Sanford skates in and takes a shot, which Randal blocks. Jay and Silent Bob deal to a player: he drops money over the ledge, and Jay throws up a dime bag.

test_cases.name: Synonym Substitution
test_cases.description: A SMOKER strides in, and Dante manages to interrupt his examination of the O.C. peculiarity and searches for the cigarettes. The smoker glances at Randal and then at the O.C. peculiarity. The smoker gazes at Randal. The peculiar fellow places a handkerchief over an egg on the floor and swiftly whisks the handkerchief away to expose the egg still resting on the floor. Dante, Randal, and the smoker gaze at the O.C. fellow. Then, a little girl enters the scene, smiling and holding money. She can't be any more than five. A female shopper pops goods onto the counter and stands silently, anticipating something. Dante rings her up. Randal flips open the magazine's centerfold, exposing a graphic image of a woman with her vaginal lips and anus spread wide open. Dante frantically apologizes to the rapidly departing shopper. Randal peruses the centerfold wistfully. A woman extracts gallon after gallon, looking deep into the cooler for the perfect container of milk. A sequence of people address the camera, posing silly inquiries, while others stand in various spots throughout the convenience store, posing truly silly inquiries. Dante gives Randal a shove to silence him. Veronica enters the store, carrying books and something covered with aluminum foil, and Dante is suddenly by her side, taking the books from under her arm. Randal makes loud slurping sounds from O.C. and walks past the two, patting Veronica on the head as he exits. She exits too. Randal is recommending titles to prospective shoppers and pops his head in to make the loud slurping sound again before hanging up. Randal joins Dante, then walks away, causing Dante to shake his head in exasperation and pick up the telephone again, rolling his eyes to the ceiling. Randal comes back. Tape is wound around the top of a stick; an orange ball is slapped back and forth by a blade, and laces are pulled tightly. Randal enters, wearing his gear as the hockey players fill the convenience store. Sanford skates up and skids to a stop, and on the roof, they jump off the ladder and skate around. From across the street, we get the full, odd perspective of a store with many men gliding around on the roof. Some sit on the floor or recline against the coolers, but all are either preparing or practicing. On the roof, Dante skates and passes with another player, while the players ascend a ladder beside the door, one by one. Randal pulls his mask on and slaps his glove, urging a shot. Sanford skates in and takes a shot, which Randal blocks. Jay and Silent Bob transact with a player: he drops money over the ledge, and Jay tosses up a dime bag.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: A SMOKER steps in, and the study of the O.C. oddity is managed to be broken by Dante, who searches for the smokes. Randal is glanced at by the smoker and then at the O.C. oddity. Randal is looked at by the smoker. A handkerchief is placed by the odd man over an egg on the floor, and the handkerchief is quickly whisked away by him to reveal the egg still sitting on the floor. The O.C. man is stared at by Dante, Randal, and the smoker. Then, a little girl comes into view, smiling and holding money. She can't be any more than five. Items are popped onto the counter by a female customer, and she stands silently, awaiting something. Her purchase is rung up by Dante. The magazine's centerfold is flipped open by Randal, revealing a graphic picture of a woman with her vaginal lips and anus spread wide open. The rapidly exiting customer is frantically apologized to by Dante. The centerfold is wistfully checked out by Randal. Gallon after gallon is pulled out by a woman, who looks deep into the cooler for the perfect container of milk. The camera is addressed by a series of people, asking dumb questions, while others stand in various locations throughout the convenience store, asking truly dumb questions. Randal is given a shove by Dante to shut him up. The store is entered by Veronica, carrying books and something covered with aluminum foil, and the books are suddenly taken by Dante from under her arm, who is then by her side. Loud slurping noises are made by Randal from O.C., and he walks past the two, patting Veronica on the head as he exits. She exits too. Titles are recommended by Randal to potential customers, and he pops his head in to make the loud slurping noise again before hanging up. Dante is joined by Randal, who then walks away, causing Dante to shake his head in frustration and pick up the phone again, rolling his eyes to the ceiling. Randal comes back. The top of a stick is rolled with tape; an orange ball is slapped back and forth by a blade, and laces are pulled tightly. The convenience store is filled by the hockey players entering with their equipment worn by Randal. Sanford skates up and skids to a halt, and they jump off the ladder and skate around on the roof. The full, odd perspective of a store with many men gliding around on the roof is seen from across the street. Some sit on the floor or lean against the coolers, but all are either preparing or practicing. Dante skates and passes with another player on the roof, while the ladder adjacent to the door is ascended by the players, one by one. A mask is pulled on by Randal, who slaps his glove, urging a shot. Sanford skates in and takes a shot, which is blocked by Randal. Jay and Silent Bob deal to a player: money is dropped over the ledge by him, and a dime bag is thrown up by Jay.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: A SMOKER enters, prompting Dante to stop studying the O.C. oddity and search for cigarettes. The smoker glances at Randal and the O.C. oddity, who performs a trick with an egg and handkerchief. Dante, Randal, and the smoker watch him. A smiling little girl, no older than five, appears with money. A female customer silently places items on the counter, and Dante rings her up. Randal opens a magazine centerfold, revealing a graphic image, causing Dante to apologize to the exiting customer. Randal admires the centerfold. A woman searches for the perfect milk container. People ask dumb questions throughout the store. Dante shoves Randal to silence him. Veronica enters with books and something wrapped in foil; Dante assists her. Randal makes slurping noises, pats Veronica's head, and exits. Randal recommends titles to customers, makes slurping noises again, and leaves Dante frustrated. Randal returns. Hockey players fill the store as Randal dons his gear. Sanford skates up, and players glide on the roof. From across the street, the store appears odd with men skating on the roof. Some sit or lean against coolers, preparing or practicing. On the roof, Dante skates and passes with another player. Randal pulls on his mask, urging a shot. Sanford shoots, and Randal blocks it. Jay and Silent Bob deal to a player, exchanging money for a dime bag.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: A SMOKER enters, and Dante stops studying the O.C. oddity to find cigarettes. The smoker glances at Randal and the O.C. oddity, who performs a trick with an egg. Dante, Randal, and the smoker watch him. A smiling little girl with money appears. A female customer silently waits as Dante rings her up. Randal opens a magazine to a graphic centerfold, prompting Dante to apologize to the exiting customer. Randal admires the centerfold. A woman searches for the perfect milk container. People ask dumb questions in the store. Dante shoves Randal to silence him. Veronica enters with books and foil-covered items; Dante takes her books. Randal makes slurping noises, pats Veronica's head, and exits. Randal recommends titles, makes slurping noises again, and leaves Dante frustrated. Randal returns. Hockey players fill the store as Randal dons his gear. Sanford skates and stops, while players practice on the roof. Dante skates and passes with another player. Randal, masked, blocks Sanford's shot. Jay and Silent Bob deal to a player, exchanging money for a dime bag.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description:
A SMOKER steps into the bustling convenience store, and Dante, who had been deeply engrossed in observing the peculiar O.C. oddity, manages to tear his attention away and begins searching for the requested smokes. The smoker, with a curious glance, looks at Randal and then shifts his gaze to the O.C. oddity. Once more, the smoker's eyes return to Randal. Meanwhile, the odd man performs a curious trick, placing a handkerchief over an egg lying on the floor and swiftly whisking it away to reveal the egg still sitting there, unchanged. Dante, Randal, and the smoker all fix their eyes on the O.C. man, captivated by his strange antics. 

Then, a little girl, no older than five, comes into view, her face lit up with a bright smile as she clutches money in her small hand. A female customer approaches the counter, placing her items down and standing silently, waiting for service. Dante efficiently rings her up. Meanwhile, Randal, with a mischievous air, flips open the magazine's centerfold, revealing a graphic image of a woman with her intimate parts exposed. Dante, realizing the situation, frantically apologizes to the customer who is now rapidly exiting the store. Randal, however, continues to gaze at the centerfold with a wistful expression. 

In another part of the store, a woman is meticulously pulling out gallon after gallon, peering deeply into the cooler in search of the perfect container of milk. A series of people address the camera, posing questions that range from silly to downright absurd, while others are scattered throughout the convenience store, each asking their own truly dumb questions. Dante, growing exasperated, gives Randal a shove to silence him. 

Veronica enters the store, her arms laden with books and something wrapped in aluminum foil. Dante is suddenly by her side, taking the books from under her arm with a helpful gesture. Randal, making loud slurping noises from the O.C., walks past the pair, playfully patting Veronica on the head as he makes his exit. She follows him out. Randal, now outside, is recommending titles to potential customers and pops his head back in to make the loud slurping noise once more before hanging up. He then joins Dante, only to walk away again, leaving Dante to shake his head in frustration, pick up the phone, and roll his eyes toward the ceiling. Randal soon returns. 

Inside the store, tape is being rolled around the top of a stick; an orange ball is being slapped back and forth by a blade, and laces are being pulled tightly. Randal enters, now clad in his hockey equipment, as the hockey players begin to fill the convenience store. Sanford skates up and skids to a halt, and on the roof, they leap off the ladder and skate around. From across the street, we are treated to the full, peculiar perspective of a store with numerous men gliding around on the roof. Some sit on the floor or lean against the coolers, but all are either preparing or practicing for the game. On the roof, Dante skates and passes the puck with another player, while the players ascend a ladder adjacent to the door, one by one. Randal pulls his mask on and slaps his glove, urging someone to take a shot. Sanford skates in and takes a shot, which Randal successfully blocks. Meanwhile, Jay and Silent Bob are conducting a deal with a player: the player drops money over the ledge, and Jay tosses up a dime bag in return.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2
test_cases.description:
A SMOKER steps into the bustling and lively convenience store, where Dante, who had been thoroughly engrossed in observing the peculiar and unusual antics of the O.C. oddity, manages to divert his attention away from the fascinating distraction and begins the task of locating the requested smokes. The smoker, with a curious and inquisitive glance, looks at Randal and then shifts his gaze over to the extraordinary O.C. oddity. Once more, the smoker's eyes return to Randal, as if trying to comprehend the scene before him. Meanwhile, the odd man, engaged in his curious and intriguing trick, places a handkerchief over an egg lying on the floor and, with a swift motion, whisks it away to reveal the egg still sitting there, completely unchanged. Dante, Randal, and the smoker all fix their eyes on the O.C. man, captivated and mesmerized by his strange and peculiar antics.

Then, a little girl, no older than five, comes into view, her face lit up with a bright and joyful smile as she clutches money tightly in her small hand. A female customer approaches the counter, placing her items down with care and standing silently, waiting patiently for service. Dante efficiently and swiftly rings her up. Meanwhile, Randal, with a mischievous air, flips open the magazine's centerfold, revealing a graphic image of a woman with her intimate parts blatantly exposed. Dante, realizing the awkwardness of the situation, frantically apologizes to the customer who is now rapidly exiting the store in obvious discomfort. Randal, however, continues to gaze at the centerfold with a wistful and longing expression.

In another part of the store, a woman is meticulously pulling out gallon after gallon of milk, peering deeply into the cooler in search of the perfect and ideal container of milk. A series of people address the camera, posing questions that range from the silly to the downright absurd, while others are scattered throughout the busy convenience store, each asking their own truly dumb and nonsensical questions. Dante, growing increasingly exasperated, gives Randal a shove in an attempt to silence him and his antics.

Veronica enters the store, her arms laden with a stack of books and something wrapped carefully in aluminum foil. Dante is suddenly by her side, taking the books from under her arm with a helpful and considerate gesture. Randal, making loud and comical slurping noises from the O.C., walks past the pair, playfully patting Veronica on the head as he makes his exit. She follows him out, still smiling. Randal, now outside, is recommending book titles to potential customers and pops his head back in to make the loud slurping noise once more before hanging up. He then temporarily joins Dante, only to walk away again, leaving Dante to shake his head in frustration, pick up the phone, and roll his eyes dramatically toward the ceiling. Randal soon returns, as expected.

Inside the store, tape is being meticulously rolled around the top of a stick; an orange ball is being slapped back and forth by a blade, and laces are being pulled tightly with care. Randal enters, now clad in his full hockey equipment, as the enthusiastic hockey players begin to fill the convenience store. Sanford skates up energetically and skids to a halt, and on the roof, they leap off the ladder and skate around with agility. From across the street, we are treated to the full, curious perspective of a store with numerous men gliding around on the roof. Some sit casually on the floor or lean against the coolers, but all are either preparing or practicing intently for the game. On the roof, Dante skates and skillfully passes the puck with another player, while the players ascend a ladder adjacent to the door, one by one. Randal pulls his mask on and slaps his glove, urging someone to take a shot with enthusiasm. Sanford skates in confidently and takes a shot, which Randal successfully and skillfully blocks. Meanwhile, Jay and Silent Bob are conducting a surreptitious deal with a player: the player drops money discreetly over the ledge, and Jay tosses up a dime bag in return, completing the transaction with a sly grin.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: A SMOKER steps into the convenience store, prompting Dante to momentarily break his intense focus on the peculiar O.C. oddity and begin searching for the cigarettes. The smoker's eyes flicker over to Randal, then shift to the O.C. oddity, and finally settle back on Randal. Meanwhile, the odd man in question places a handkerchief over an egg lying on the floor, swiftly whisking the handkerchief away to reveal the egg still sitting there, unchanged. Dante, Randal, and the smoker all fix their gaze on the O.C. man, captivated by his strange act. At this moment, a little girl, no older than five, comes into view, her face lit up with a smile as she clutches money in her hand. A female customer approaches the counter, silently placing her items down and waiting expectantly. Dante proceeds to ring up her purchases. In the meantime, Randal flips open a magazine to its centerfold, revealing a graphic image of a woman with her vaginal lips and anus spread wide open. Dante, realizing the situation, frantically apologizes to the customer who is now rapidly exiting the store. Randal, however, continues to gaze at the centerfold with a wistful expression. Nearby, a woman is methodically pulling out gallon after gallon, peering deeply into the cooler in search of the perfect container of milk. Throughout the store, a series of people address the camera, posing dumb questions, while others stand in various locations, asking truly dumb questions. In an attempt to silence Randal, Dante gives him a shove. Veronica enters the store, her arms laden with books and something wrapped in aluminum foil, and Dante quickly moves to her side, taking the books from under her arm. As Randal makes loud slurping noises from the O.C. and walks past the pair, he pats Veronica on the head before making his exit. She follows suit and exits as well. Randal, now recommending titles to potential customers, pops his head back in to make the loud slurping noise once more before hanging up. He then joins Dante, only to walk away again, leaving Dante to shake his head in frustration, pick up the phone, and roll his eyes toward the ceiling. Randal soon returns. Tape is being rolled around the top of a stick; an orange ball is being slapped back and forth by a blade, and laces are being pulled tightly. Randal enters, now clad in his hockey equipment, as the hockey players begin to fill the convenience store. Sanford skates up and comes to a skidding halt, and on the roof, players jump off the ladder and skate around. From across the street, the full, odd perspective of the store is visible, with many men gliding around on the roof. Some sit on the floor or lean against the coolers, but all are either preparing or practicing. On the roof, Dante skates and passes the ball with another player, while the players ascend a ladder adjacent to the door, one by one. Randal pulls his mask on and slaps his glove, urging someone to take a shot. Sanford skates in and takes a shot, which Randal successfully blocks. Meanwhile, Jay and Silent Bob conduct a deal with a player: the player drops money over the ledge, and Jay tosses up a dime bag in exchange.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: A smoker enters, prompting Dante to momentarily shift his focus from the O.C. oddity to search for cigarettes. The smoker exchanges glances with Randal and the O.C. oddity, who performs a quick magic trick with an egg, capturing the attention of Dante, Randal, and the smoker. A little girl, no older than five, appears with a smile and money in hand. Meanwhile, a female customer silently places items on the counter, and Dante rings her up. Randal, engrossed in a magazine, reveals a graphic centerfold, causing Dante to apologize to the departing customer. Randal continues to admire the centerfold. A woman searches the cooler for the perfect milk container, while various customers ask nonsensical questions throughout the store. Dante silences Randal with a shove. Veronica enters with books and a foil-covered item, and Dante assists her by taking the books. Randal makes a loud slurping noise as he exits, patting Veronica on the head. He later returns, recommending titles to customers and repeating the slurping noise before leaving again. Dante, frustrated, shakes his head and picks up the phone. Randal reappears, now in hockey gear, as players fill the store. Sanford skates up, and on the roof, players jump off the ladder and skate around. From across the street, the store's roof is a peculiar sight with men gliding around. Some players sit or lean against coolers, preparing or practicing. On the roof, Dante skates and passes with another player, while others ascend the ladder. Randal dons his mask and encourages a shot, which Sanford takes and Randal blocks. Jay and Silent Bob conduct a transaction with a player, exchanging money for a dime bag over the ledge.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: A SMOKER steps in, and Dante, who works at a small, locally-owned convenience store known for its eclectic customers, manages to break his study of the O.C. oddity and searches for the smokes. The smoker glances at Randal, who is known for his sarcastic demeanor, and then at the O.C. oddity. The smoker looks at Randal. The odd man, one of the store's regulars known for his frequent magic tricks, places a handkerchief over an egg on the floor and quickly whisks the handkerchief away to reveal the egg still sitting on the floor. Dante, Randal, and the smoker stare at the O.C. man. Then, a little girl comes into view, smiling and holding money from her allowance. She can't be any more than five. A female customer, an office worker on her lunch break, pops items onto the counter and stands silently, awaiting something. Dante rings her up efficiently after years of experience. Randal flips open the magazine's centerfold, revealing a graphic picture of a woman with her vaginal lips and anus spread wide open, which was accidentally shelved by the delivery driver in place of a fashion magazine. Dante frantically apologizes to the rapidly exiting customer. Randal, unfazed, checks out the centerfold wistfully. A woman pulls out gallon after gallon, looking deep into the cooler for the perfect container of milk that expires the latest. A series of people address the camera, engaging in a project for a local film class, asking dumb questions, while others stand in various locations throughout the convenience store, asking truly dumb questions. Dante gives Randal a shove to shut him up. Veronica enters the store, carrying books for her college classes and something covered with aluminum foil, and Dante is suddenly by her side, taking the books from under her arm. Randal makes loud slurping noises from O.C., imitating an old cartoon character, and walks past the two, patting Veronica on the head as he exits. She exits too. Randal is recommending titles from his personal book club to potential customers and pops his head in to make the loud slurping noise again before hanging up. Randal joins Dante, then walks away, causing Dante to shake his head in frustration and pick up the phone again, rolling his eyes to the ceiling at Randal's antics. Randal comes back. Tape is rolled around the top of a stick; an orange ball is slapped back and forth by a blade, and laces are pulled tightly, signaling the start of their rooftop hockey game, a local tradition among the group. Randal enters, wearing his equipment as the hockey players, a hodgepodge of friends and acquaintances, fill the convenience store. Sanford, known for his speed on skates, skates up and skids to a halt, and on the roof, they jump off the ladder and skate around. From across the street, we get the full, odd perspective of a store with many men gliding around on the roof. Some sit on the floor or lean against the coolers, but all are either preparing or practicing. On the roof, Dante skates and passes with another player, while the players ascend a ladder adjacent to the door, one by one. Randal pulls his mask on, reminiscent of a professional goalie, and slaps his glove, urging a shot. Sanford skates in and takes a shot, which Randal blocks expertly. Jay and Silent Bob, local small-time dealers, deal to a player: he drops money over the ledge, and Jay throws up a dime bag from his usual stash.

On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles nature’s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the city’s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. She exits too. Randal is recommending titles to potential customers and pops his head in to make the loud slurping noise again before hanging up. Randal joins. Dante then walks away causing Dante to shake his head in frustration and pick up the phone again rolling his eyes to the ceiling. Randal comes back. Tape is rolled around the top of a stick. an orange ball is slapped back and forth by a blade and laces are pulled tightly. Randal enters wearing his equipment as the hockey players fill the convenience store. Sanford skates up and skids to a halt and on the roof. they jump off the ladder and skate around. From across the street we get the full odd perspective of a store with many men gliding around on the roof. Some sit on the floor or lean against the coolers but all are either preparing or practicing. On the roof Dante skates and passes with another player while the players ascend a ladder adjacent to the door one by one. Randal pulls his mask on and slaps his glove urging a shot. Sanford skates in and takes a shot which Randal blocks. Jay and Silent Bob deal to a player. he drops money over the ledge and Jay throws up a dime bag.

test_cases.description: A SMOKER steps in and Dante manages to break his study of the OC oddity and searches for the smokes. The smoker glances at Randal and then at the OC oddity. The smoker looks at Randal. The odd man places a handkerchief over an egg on the floor and quickly whisks the handkerchief away to reveal the egg still sitting on the floor. Dante Randal and the smoker stare at the OC man. Then a little girl comes into view smiling and holding money. She cannot be any more than five. A female customer pops items onto the counter and stands silently awaiting something. Dante rings her up. they jump off the ladder and skate around. From across the street we get the full odd perspective of a store with many men gliding around on the roof. Some sit on the floor or lean against the coolers but all are either preparing or practicing. On the roof Dante skates and passes with another player while the players ascend a ladder adjacent to the door one by one. Randal pulls his mask on and slaps his glove urging a shot. Sanford skates in and takes a shot which Randal blocks. Jay and Silent Bob deal to a player. he drops money over the ledge and Jay throws up a dime bag.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: A DIVER hops out, and Lenny attempts to mend his examination of the E.A. marvel and hunts for the tickets. The diver peeks at Gerald and then at the E.A. marvel. The diver peers at Gerald. The strange fellow lays a napkin over a jellybean on the table and swiftly flicks the napkin away to uncover the jellybean still resting on the table. Lenny, Gerald, and the diver gaze at the E.A. fellow. Then, a tiny boy appears, laughing and clutching a pencil. He can't be any older than seven. A male shopper drops gadgets onto the shelf and stands silently, expecting something. Lenny checks him out. Gerald snaps open the novel's finale, displaying a vivid illustration of a dragon with its wings and tail fully spread. Lenny hurriedly apologizes to the swiftly retreating shopper. Gerald examines the finale longingly. A man pulls out loaf after loaf, peering deep into the pantry for the ideal bundle of bread. A cluster of folks address the lens, posing silly inquiries, while others linger in diverse spots throughout the deli, posing genuinely silly inquiries. Lenny nudges Gerald to silence him. Abigail steps into the deli, holding notebooks and something wrapped with wax paper, and Lenny is suddenly next to her, taking the notebooks from under her elbow. Gerald makes deafening crunching sounds from E.A. and strides past the pair, patting Abigail on the shoulder as he departs. She departs too. Gerald is suggesting films to prospective patrons and pops his head in to make the deafening crunching sound again before hanging up. Gerald rejoins Lenny, then strolls away, causing Lenny to shake his head in exasperation and pick up the remote again, rolling his eyes to the wall. Gerald returns. Ribbon is wrapped around the end of a broom; a red balloon is bounced back and forth by a spoon, and shoelaces are cinched securely. Gerald enters, donning his uniform as the runners flood the deli. Sheldon jogs up and skids to a stop, and on the canopy, they leap off the stairs and dash around. From across the avenue, we get the full, strange view of a deli with many people sliding around on the canopy. Some sit on the ground or rest against the shelves, but all are either warming up or rehearsing. On the canopy, Lenny skates and tosses with another runner, while the runners climb a rope alongside the entrance, one by one. Gerald pulls his hood on and whacks his mitt, urging a pass. Sheldon jogs in and attempts a pass, which Gerald deflects. Tom and Quiet Joe trade with a runner: he tosses coins over the railing, and Tom pitches up a candy bar.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby café, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: Dante studies an odd man performing an egg trick as a smoker and Randal watch. A little girl and a silent female customer appear, with Dante ringing up the latter. Randal embarrassingly opens a magazine centerfold, prompting Dante's frantic apology as the customer leaves. Meanwhile, a woman searches for milk, and various customers ask dumb questions. Veronica enters, and Dante assists her with books; Randal disruptively slurps and pats her head. Randal annoys Dante with recommendations and loud noises. Later, Randal and Dante prepare for a rooftop hockey game, with players gathering in the store and ascending a ladder. On the roof, the game unfolds with Randal blocking shots, and Jay and Silent Bob dealing to a player below.
